content.statement: proc-030-micropuncture is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding proc-030-micropuncture helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of proc-030-micropuncture include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of proc-030-micropuncture.

definitions_glossary.micropuncture_system: Kit with 21G needle, 0.018-inch wire, and coaxial dilator for exchange
definitions_glossary.coaxial_dilator: Dilator with inner component for 0.018 wire, outer component for 0.035 wire
definitions_glossary.platinum_tip: High-visibility wire tip for fluoroscopic confirmation
definitions_glossary.transitional_sheath: Sheath allowing exchange from small to standard wire system

indications: Anticoagulated patients (reduces bleeding from failed attempts)
Obese patients (reduces bleeding if vein punctured)
Patients with prior access site complications
contraindications: Emergent access requiring large sheath immediately (relative)

steps: Puncture artery with 21G needle at 45° angle

wire_advancement.abnormal: Wire meets resistance - likely subintimal or in branch
wire_advancement.action_if_resistance: Remove wire, reposition needle, try again

complications.management: Reposition, inject contrast to confirm position

evidence.anticoagulated_patients: Preferred technique for patients on anticoagulation

definition.@value: Vascular access technique using a 21G needle and 0.018-inch wire system with coaxial exchange to standard equipment, reducing access complications

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the components of a micropuncture access system
Perform micropuncture access with coaxial exchange
Identify ideal situations for micropuncture technique
clinical_pearls: If the 0.018 wire won't advance freely, you're not intraluminal - don't force it
Micropuncture is ideal for radial access - the small needle matches the small artery
The coaxial exchange is the key step - inner out with small wire, outer stays for big wire
Use micropuncture for all anticoagulated patients - bleeding from failed sticks is minimized
Combine with ultrasound guidance for best results

medicalCode.description: Introduction of needle or intracatheter; extremity artery
Introduction of other therapeutic substance into peripheral artery, percutaneous approach
